intro: Oxydectes mubango, commonly known as the Mubango tree, is a deciduous tree native to Central and Southern Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes other well-known plants like the cashew and mango. The tree can grow up to 20 meters tall, with a broad, spreading canopy and thick, fissured bark. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a distinctive serrated margin. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by edible, fleshy fruits containing a single seed.
